name: A. Divisible by Seven
statement:
You have number , whose decimal representation quite luckily contains
digits 1, 6, 8, 9. Rearrange the digits in its decimal representation so
that the resulting number will be divisible by 7.Number doesn’t contain
any leading zeroes and contains digits 1, 6, 8, 9 (it also can contain
another digits). The resulting number also mustn’t contain any leading
zeroes.
editorial:
Because permutation of 1, 6, 8, 9 can form integers
that mod 7 equals 0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6. So you can construct answer like
this: nonzero digits + a permutation of 1, 6, 8, 9 + zeros.
